candidates.name: Julie Emerson
candidates.currentRole: Challenger for Board of Education Trustee
candidates.bio: Julie Emerson is a real estate professional and parent of Elizabeth Emerson (Transit Middle School) and Shepard Emerson (Country Parkway Elementary). She is seeking election to the Williamsville Central School District Board of Education to learn the needs of the district and help make lasting improvements for teachers, staff, parents, and students.
key_policies: Advocate for lasting improvements for teachers and staff
Engage with parents and community through service
Focus on student needs and academic excellence
Volunteer-driven, service-oriented leadership
Enhance communication between district stakeholders
candidates.additional_notes: PTSA Council Meet the Candidates Night: Tuesday, May 13, 2025 at approximately 7:00 p.m. following the Annual Budget Hearing at 6:00 p.m.

candidates.name: Mark A. Manna
candidates.bio: Mark A. Manna is a labor contract negotiator and pension trustee with step-children in Williamsville North High School. In his first term on the Board, he helped expand modified sports opportunities, develop responsible budgets, and foster positive relationships across the district. He seeks re-election to maintain high-quality academic and extracurricular programs and implement a device-free school environment.
key_policies: Expand modified sports opportunities
Implement responsible budgeting and fiscal oversight
Foster positive relationships with parents, teachers, and staff
Ban electronic devices during the school day
Maintain high-quality educational and extracurricular programs
candidates.additional_notes: Seeking re-election for the term July 1, 2025–June 30, 2028.

candidates.name: Philip G. Danielson
candidates.currentRole: Challenger for Board of Education Trustee
candidates.bio: Philip G. Danielson is Lead Project Manager at KeyBank and parent to Emma (Williamsville North ’22) and Isla (7th grade, Casey Middle). He volunteers with Friends Feeding Friends and Good News Global, and pledges to advocate for conservative, traditional education, budget stewardship, and strong district oversight.
key_policies: Advocate for conservative and traditional perspective in curriculum
Steward the budget with project management skills
Ensure accountability of district leadership
Support parental concerns around DEI and athletics
Promote strong moral and academic standards
candidates.additional_notes: Running for one of three open seats in the May 20, 2025 election.

candidates.name: Stuart M. Bulan
candidates.bio: Stuart M. Bulan is a history teacher with 27 years of experience and parent of two Williamsville students. He has served on the Board since 2022 and uses his educational expertise to help all students and teachers succeed.
key_policies: Ensure success for students and teachers
Apply teaching experience to board governance
Support special education and inclusive programs
Promote a positive classroom environment
Advocate for data-driven improvements
candidates.additional_notes: Seeking re-election for the term July 1, 2025–June 30, 2028.

candidates.name: Christina Bleckinger
candidates.bio: Christina Bleckinger is an AVP and healthcare sales consultant with a BS in Accounting and Computer Science from UB. She chairs wellness committees and leads SWAP, prioritizing student mental wellness and healthy choices.
key_policies: Prioritize mental wellness and health initiatives
Promote healthy food and nutrition choices
Nurture whole-child development
Advocate for student voice and engagement
Support sustainable educator and staff programs
candidates.additional_notes: Seeking re-election for the term July 1, 2025–June 30, 2028.
